replies.body: I believe the huge cut to support gold items are ridiculous, how else will support gets gold when they cant take CS..??

Agreed.  Relic Shield supports _rely_ on the passive gold-per-ten when the laning phase ends and we just can't get auto-attacks in before the mages and marksmen have completely cleared the wave.  This is doubly true for tanky supports who are technically "ranged", like Thresh, and don't have access to the execute, or even while in-lane with inconsiderate ADCs (**ESPECIALLY** with the changes you just made to minion gold).
The nerf to Relic Shield / Targon's is to balance it against the extra gold cannon minions are getting -- it ends up being about the same amount of gold generation in the long run.
Unless you're in a ranged matchup that can bully the hell out of the melee supports out of getting cannons that is.

So let me see if I understand this, they nerf the living heck outta locket and reduce the gold per 10 of relic shield. If tank supports want roughly the same amount of gold they are forced to take cannon minions which puts them in prime poke territory. This just gets harder as the game goes on when you have to compete with the ADC and mages. I mean we could take the minion dematerializer, but I would really rather not if possible and there is only 6 charges. Idk if this is gonna be a good patch for tank supports.

Yes, the game does reward smart utilization of items and prioritization of objectives. Fighting over cannons is how the game is forcing interaction between laners that might otherwise not interact at all. More interaction leads to better expression of skill. 

Yes, they can save skill shots to hit you while you walk up to a cannon, but if you bait the skill shot and dodge it, miss the cannon and then all-in on them while the abilities are on CD, then you win the trade or outright kill that Lux. It is worth.

Additionally, relic shield users can use their passive almost all game. Frostfang users can’t as the game passes from persistent laning interaction to dancing around engages.

There are some explanations that might alliviate your concerns. Also, you should try asking your team to let you execute. If they don’t, keep asking. If they still don’t, then that’s the way things are. Not everything is perfect.

Sir, you're a top laner. I checked. It doesn't work the same way. One cool down doesn't mean the enemy is vulnerable like it does in top lane, especially when there is a ranged ADC who doesn't need to cast anything to destroy you for trying to get the tank minion and you can't plan a juke that will allow a tank to dive two enemies like that. Also, why wouldn't the other support items remain relevant throughout the game and did you not read that it gets harder to execute siege minions later on? It's true, especially when people can lose the gold if your execute rewards some other player who got closer to you when you execute it. They want more fun for them, and telling us that it's just too bad is not a valid argument. Riot introduced support and jungle items to ensure that these roles didn't feel so sacrificial and frustrating so that our team could win. You should have a little sympathy rather than debate over roles that you don't play with people who do.

Just a bronzie here but its seems to me with the removal of bandit you already hurt the support position. Now you are further nerfing the item that tank supports tend to use. It is very disheartening to say the least.

As stated in 8.5 and from developer talks on PBE tests, Bandit was removed after it was nerfed several times because non-supports were abusing its gold efficiency (top picks like teemo, adc doing the Targon run, etc) so the gold generation for the support types were buffed (gold from hits with Frostfang, gold pickups, etc) while removing bandit and halting other aspects. 

For this patch targeted nerf on tanks who can play way more passive, dip in for the gold proc, pad back if needed and overall staying gold efficient while squishy non-tank picks have to make riskier dips to land hits / procs and get all-in'd if caught is partly why.
Simple. Give the supports a support only summoner spell like the JG have and make the support items only available to those who have the spell.
